title: [Self-directed] Practical Readiness Enhancement Program for Pediatric and Family Health Nurses

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational nursing theory and clinical practice experience
context.additional_context: Blended education course design combining practice-based learning and mentoring for advanced professional learners in manager/leader roles

learning_goals: Learners achieve mastery of over 90% in core skills required for pediatric and family health nursing practice through field training.
Learners develop case-specific problem-solving strategies through mentoring and apply them to real-world scenarios.

Learners produce a monthly technology trend analysis report twice over six months, complete one online course (platform: Coursera/Udemy) per quarter, and execute one practical project linked to company tasks. Learning outcomes are measured via KPIs (knowledge acquisition ≥80%, project application ≥70%) to implement a self-directed learning plan
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
